info.game_comments:
2002 College Championship quarterfinal game 3.
From the Schottenstein Center at the Ohio State University in Columbus.

(1, 1).clue: This New York island is named for the Indians who sold it to Peter Minuit in 1626

(2, 1).clue: As Daphne in the 2002 live-action film, she traded in her vampire stakes for Scooby snacks

(3, 1).clue: The National Consumer Council warns that on a credit card, beware of a high APR, which stands for this

(4, 1).clue: Much of Moscow was burned to the ground in 1812 when this emperor's troops occupied the city

(5, 1).clue: A golden one of these symbolizes Kappa Kappa Gamma as well as Phi Beta Kappa

(6, 1).clue: Women sometimes wear clothing that bares this part of the body between the chest & the waist

(1, 2).clue: Possibly meaning "great salt water" or "on the big bay", it's the big bay that divides Maryland

(2, 2).clue: Rastro -- sorry -- Astro on this Hanna-Barbera series was a prototype for Scooby

(3, 2).clue: The name of this beauty products store comes from the Greek word for beauty & Zipporah, the name of Moses' wife

(4, 2).clue: He posted his world-shaking commentaries on a German church door on October 31, 1517

(5, 2).clue: Ancient instrument symbolizing Alpha Chi Omega, whose original motto was "Ye Daughters of Music, Come Up Higher"

(6, 2).clue: This term for a top law enforcement official comes from the English for "reeve of the shire"

(1, 3).clue: Oh, b'gosh!  This Wisconsin city bears the name of a Menominee chief who died in 1858

(2, 3).clue: Relatives of Scooby seen over the years include Scooby-Dum & this annoying nephew

(3, 3).clue: Seen here, the logo of this store recalls its employees' uniforms

(4, 3).clue: The arrival of the contaminated ship David Scott in 1834 began a series of severe measles epidemics in this Aussie city

(5, 3).clue: In 1989 Zeta Beta Tau dropped this pre-membership status as the only way to stop hazing

(6, 3).clue: At Cape Canaveral, it follows a countdown

(1, 4).clue: Referring to its Platte River, this state's name is from an Indian word meaning "flat water"

(2, 4).clue: Scooby parodies turn up in "Jay & Silent Bob Strike Back" & one of the endings to this 1992 Mike Myers film

(3, 4).clue: This retail clothing chain started out as a single store in San Francisco in 1969 that sold jeans & records

(4, 4).clue: It was the first presidential election year following the end of the U.S. Civil War

(5, 4).clue: In 1902 Pi Beta Phi was a founding member of the NPC, this "National Conference" of Greek-letter societies

(6, 4).clue: This annual cooking contest first took place in 1949 at New York City's Waldorf-Astoria Hotel

(1, 5).clue: This Pennsylvania valley gave its name to the transport seen here

(2, 5).clue: Keep your feet on the ground & keep reaching for the stars & tell us he's the original voice of Shaggy

(3, 5).clue: With locations throughout the U.S., this "Wild Place to Shop and Eat" recreates the jungle indoors

(4, 5).clue: This modeler in wax who founded a world-famous museum was born in Strasbourg in 1761

(5, 5).clue: The first post-Civil War fraternity, Alpha Tau Omega started at this "institute" that trained many Civil War generals

(6, 5).clue: This Arizona city is the site of the Lowell Observatory & an annual summerfest

(1, 1).clue: Part of the Arabian Peninsula is occupied by the Rub Al-Khali, or "empty quarter", one of the largest of these

(2, 1).clue: In April 2005 he'll have hosted NBC's "Late Night" as long as his predecessor did

(3, 1).clue: This 1859 classic begins, "It was the best of times, it was the worst of times"

(4, 1).clue: This NYC building opened in 1931 -- & had an ape infestation problem on film just 2 years later

(5, 1).clue: This Japanese volcano's 1707 eruption scattered ash over Tokyo & caused several days of darkness

(6, 1).clue: His name's on 3 epistles, a revelation & a gospel

(1, 2).clue: In 1991 retreating Iraqi troops looted this country & set fire to hundreds of its oil wells

(2, 2).clue: An Oprah regular, this expert in "Psychology and Human Functioning" got his own show in 2002

(3, 2).clue: His "Life of Samuel Johnson" is often considered the greatest biography in the English language

(4, 2).clue: This term coined in the '50s refers to an amusement park with a motif, like the jungle or the Old West

(5, 2).clue: This dormant volcano graces the license plates of Washington state

(6, 2).clue: Districts in London & New York City share this name

(1, 3).clue: The Kaaba in the courtyard of this city's Al-Haram Mosque is said to have been built by the Hebrew patriarch Abraham

(2, 3).clue: Bill Maher's final guests on this show included conservative commentator Ann Coulter & Kid of Kid 'n Play

(3, 3).clue: Kurtz' dying words in this Joseph Conrad tale are "The horror!  The horror!"

(4, 3).clue: Crested Butte in this state is one of the birthplaces of mountain biking & home of the Mountain Bike Hall of Fame

(5, 3).clue: One of Europe's few active volcanoes, it rises to 4,190 feet from the shores of the Bay of Naples

(6, 3).clue: Last name of father & son Nobel Prize physicists Niels & Aage

(1, 4).clue: The Arabian Peninsula's southernmost tip lies in this country

(2, 4).clue: He hosted one of the first audience-participation talk shows in 1967 & was back on the air in 2002

(3, 4).clue: In 1794 William Blake followed up his "Songs of Innocence" poems with his "Songs of" this

(4, 4).clue: Nathanael Greene of Rhode Island was the first man immortalized in 3 dimensions in this U.S. Capitol hall set up in 1864

(5, 4).clue: In the mid-1960s the volcano Irazu showered tons of ash over this Costa Rican capital

(6, 4).clue: This small salmon of the Northwest was introduced to the Great Lakes

(1, 5).clue: At over 1,000 feet, the world's tallest hotel is in this United Arab Emirates city, "The Venice of the Gulf"

(2, 5).clue: She's the talk show host mentioned in the Offspring song "Pretty Fly for a White Guy"

(3, 5).clue: This E.M. Forster novel is told in 3 parts: "Mosque", "Caves" & "Temple"

(4, 5).clue: (Sofia of the Clue Crew reports from the Johnson Space Center in Houston)  NASA's shuttle program is officially designated STS, standing for this

(5, 5).clue: From the Latin for "smoke chamber", it's a vent or hole in the ground that emits volcanic gases

(6, 5).clue: It's the discontinuity between the Earth's crust & mantle

(0, 0).clue: IBM engineer Dave Bradley is called the father of this multi-key combination
